details.company_type: Distributor/SupplierMachine/Tool Shop or Precision MachiningMedical Devices
details.description: Using the latest computer-controlled state-of-the-art equipment, CrossWind Machining is a Swiss Screw Machine Shop that specializes in providing high quality, machined metal & plastic components to device manufacturers & assembly companies. Today, multiple industries need CNC Swiss Screw Machining technology to meet the precision demands of contemporary technological needs including Medical Device, Aerospace, Microwave and Electronics. With 6-7 axis high speed machining capability, our machines can hold tolerances of +/- .0001 and can perform both turning and milling in a single operation. Thus, easily accomplishing our customers’ demands for extreme, high precision and quality finishes at high speed production capacity and often reducing or even eliminating the need for second operation processes. Partnering with CrossWind Machining and our highly experienced team can make your design(s) more “manufacturable” while still maintaining the highest quality and in many cases, improving your bottom line cost!

name: Advanced Control Systems
products_manufactured: As a person involved with an automation system, you must ensure its continuous operation. ACS provides support to help you address any issues in the electrical control system, resulting in reduced downtime and increased efficiency.  ACS provides control system integration products and services, which include control panel assembly, PLC or programmable logic controllers and programming, human-machine interfaces (HMI) and programming, and integration of sensors, transmitters, controls, and supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) products and programming.

details.owner_certifications: Certified SBA Small or Minority-owned Business,Women-owned
details.naics_code_(primary): 334519: Other Measuring and Controlling Device Manufacturing
details.company_type: Assembler/IntegratorDesign & IntegrationElectronics and related products (e.g. PCBs, cabling, ICs)
details.description: Advanced Control Systems provides control system integration products and services, which include control panel assembly, PLC or programmable logic controllers and programming, human-machine interfaces (HMI) and programming, and integration of sensors, transmitters, controls, and supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) products and programming.We have experience providing such products and services for water treatment, wastewater treatment, water collections, water reclamation plants, food processing plants, manufacturing plants, agricultural facilities, semiconductor fabrication plants, and many more concerns.Advanced Control Systems, LLC (ACS) emerges as a prominent figure in the control system integration sector, unfolding its journey from a humble beginning in 1992 to establishing a robust presence across the Pacific Northwest and beyond. Founded by Curt and Deanne Landreth, A.C.S. transitioned from focusing on Computer Numerical Control repair work from their home garage to specializing in solving comprehensive control and automation challenges for a diverse clientele, including large corporations and small organizations such as The J.R. Simplot Company and Oden Water Association.Embarking upon three decades in the industry, ACS has meticulously curated services that intersect with demands for automation across various sectors. From delivering custom SCADA upgrades for small municipal water districts to engaging in substantial projects with large-scale corporate clients, the ACS team, stationed strategically in the greater Boise area of Idaho, extends its reach not only across the PNW (encompassing states like Idaho, Oregon, and Washington) but also globally, encompassing Arizona, Wisconsin, Utah, Oklahoma, and Canada.Navigating its journey with 16 dedicated employees, ACS encapsulates a reservoir of knowledge and skills, spearheaded by a team involving Technicians, Programmers, Business Development Personnel, and Administrative Assistants. The deployment of a specialized team equipped with diverse tools, training, and certifications enables ACS to address proficiently client needs in Engineering System Design, Information Technology Professional Services, and Wireless Mobility Solutions.ACS has steadfastly adhered to a mission aimed at enhancing its customers' quality of life and profitability through automation and information solutions. Their dedication to honest design and engineering, comprehensive integration services, adept service & support, and insightful training manifests in every project. With a structured four-phase integrated management approach involving the Discovery, Design, Delivery, and Sustain phases, ACS aligns its methodologies with Lean, Six Sigma, and other efficient processes, ensuring that solutions delivered are custom, complete, and user-friendly.ACS's default modus operandi does not involve subcontracting unless specified by clients. The company's journey thus far reflects a robust capability in delivering specialized automation and control solutions and paints a story of resilience, consistency, and a staunch commitment to its values and mission, ensuring it stands as a reliable partner for its existing and prospective clientele.

name: Greyloch LLC
products_manufactured: New Facility.Greyloch is proud to introduce our 96,909 sqft advanced cabinet manufacturing facility located in Star, Idaho. Our facility is fully automated and equipped with the latest technology manufactured by Homag located in Schopfloch Germany. This allows us to efficiently create custom cabinetry for both residential and commercial projects. Our facility is designed to deliver the highest quality product while minimizing waste and product lead times. The manufacturing line is designed to take sheet good materials to a completely assembled product boxed and ready for delivery. It is able to accomplish this production through state-of-the-art machines capable of cutting, edgebanding, drilling, and gluing. This process is able to maximize the yield of raw products through the optimization and reuse of off-cut material reducing the total amount of waste. With the new Sorteq sorting system, the line is able to cut, band, and store up to 2,500 cabinet parts ready for assembly. This allows for production to maintain a consistent flow through the drill and assembly process keeping production times down and product moving to the customers sooner.

details.naics_code_(primary): 337110: Wood Kitchen Cabinet and Countertop Manufacturing
details.company_type: Distributor/Supplier
details.description: Greyloch is a family-owned business started in 1991 by Shaun and Dianne Fickes. We are a family-owned business dedicated to crafting exceptional custom cabinets that transform any space. Our mission is to deliver the highest quality, handcrafted cabinetry that reflects the unique style and needs of each individual customer.We strive to build long-lasting relationships with our clients, treating them like family and working closely with them throughout the entire design and manufacturing process. By understanding their vision, preferences, and functional requirements, we create custom cabinets and manufactured products hat not only enhance the beauty of their spaces, but also maximize functionality and storage efficiency.With a deep commitment to craftsmanship, we employ a team of skilled artisans who take pride in their meticulous attention to detail. They utilize premium materials, innovative techniques, and state-of-the-art equipment to bring our client's visions to life. Every cabinet we create bears the mark of our unwavering dedication to quality, ensuring that it will withstand the test of time and provide enduring satisfaction.
details.products_manufactured: New Facility.Greyloch is proud to introduce our 96,909 sqft advanced cabinet manufacturing facility located in Star, Idaho. Our facility is fully automated and equipped with the latest technology manufactured by Homag located in Schopfloch Germany. This allows us to efficiently create custom cabinetry for both residential and commercial projects. Our facility is designed to deliver the highest quality product while minimizing waste and product lead times. The manufacturing line is designed to take sheet good materials to a completely assembled product boxed and ready for delivery. It is able to accomplish this production through state-of-the-art machines capable of cutting, edgebanding, drilling, and gluing. This process is able to maximize the yield of raw products through the optimization and reuse of off-cut material reducing the total amount of waste. With the new Sorteq sorting system, the line is able to cut, band, and store up to 2,500 cabinet parts ready for assembly. This allows for production to maintain a consistent flow through the drill and assembly process keeping production times down and product moving to the customers sooner.We offer European Frameless Cabinets with the best drawer and hinge hardware with 10 times the output per employee compared to our leading competitors in the local market producing upwards of 300 cabinets in a 8-hour shift.Our focus is on producing modern slab panel products in a large variety of wood grain, matte, and gloss finishes.At our facility, we use only premium materials and take every measure to ensure the strength and durability of our products. Every cabinet is thoroughly inspected during the production process to guarantee that it meets our strict quality standards. Our team of professionals is committed to delivering exceptional customer service and completing each project within the given timeframe.

details.description: Uncle Dan’s® Seasonings and Salad Dressings has been making the best salad dressings, dips and seasonings for over 50 years. In 1966, Uncle Dan was working out of his home in Washington state combining various spices and packaging them in sandwich bags. Shortly after, Dan realized he had something special. Our 'Original Southern Dressing' (now called Classic Ranch) was the first recipe that Uncle Dan offered as a retail item under his newly established company. Now offering a variety of flavors, Uncle Dan's has grown exponentially. Uncle Dan's son, Chris, has taken over as President of the company, and to this day we still use the same great recipe Uncle Dan invented 57 years ago.

products_manufactured: Sunburst Lean Manufacturing (SLM) is a database software system for small to medium sized manufacturers. SLM borrows from the concepts of lean manufacturing and just-in-time production in order to reduce inventory costs and wastage. It controls the manufacturing process from initial order through manufacturing to billing. SLM uses a kanban pull system for replenishing parts. The assembly process includes purchased parts from outside vendors that are managed through the Purchase Order system.

Mission And VisionAeroLEDs was formed in 2005 with the intent to redefine aviation lighting as it existed for the last 50 years. With great attention to engineering function balanced with due consideration to product form, we have redefined the expectations of what and how aircraft lighting will be judged.See the difference. Feel the difference. Know the differenceAeroLEDs™ landing and navigational lighting products are designed for some of the most extreme operating conditions on the planet.With the focus on efficiency, reliability and natural lighting, the company has introduced revolutionary landing and navigational lighting products that produce far better results than traditional lighting systems.AeroLEDs™ introduced the world’s first LED‐based Nav/Strobe lighting product that meets TSOs C30C and C96a‐C2. The PULSAR line was designed from a “clean sheet,” utilizing advanced mechanical/electrical computer modeling and optical ray‐tracing software to accurately predict the performance of the final product. The design addressed the shortcoming of the existing line of competitive products which includes: zero maintenance, reduced power consumption by 80%, no harmful substances such as Xenon or mercury, extended light performance, lighter weight, reduced Aero‐dynamic drag and is a direct retro‐fit when replacing legacy products with no mounting modifications.All AeroLEDs™ landing lights have built‐in Wig/Wag that is designed to stand alone or be synchronous with any of AeroLEDs™ other landing light products. AeroLEDs™ landing lights are also designed to last longer than traditional legacy lighting and are protected against overheating with a built‐in production circuit to include lightning transients and ESD, voltage spikes, reverse voltage and under voltage conditions.

details.description: HistoryIn 1994, Alexander Co., which had been in the grain cleaning and processing business since 1985, began a new value added business of pearling barley for use in the food and pet food industry. As the pearl barley business grew, Alexander Co. began looking for additional value added business. Through research, it was found that SE Idaho was ideal for raising oats. By 2005, Alexander had built a new food grade oat milling plant to provide new markets for local growers and to provide broader range of products for our customers.As Alexander Co. grew, they began doing business with Cereal Byproducts Co. and in 2006, Alexander Co. and Cereal Byproducts Co. entered into a marketing agreement. Cereal Byproducts provides procurement and marketing services and Alexander Co. can concentrate on milling. Through this partnership, Alexander has expanded production capacity, increased warehouse space, and has added state of the art color sorting equipment to help improve both product quality and customer service. This relationship has allowed Alexander Co. to become one of the largest processors of pearl barley in the United States, shipping over 30,000 tons of pearl barley to customers from New York to California and Mexico.

details.description: Owning the earliest patent on 3D printing continuous fibers; our technology, known as Continuous Fiber 3D Printing (CF3D™), constitutes a fundamental shift in the manufacturing process of Advanced Composite Materials (ACM). Our technology leverages rapid curing resins paired with continuous fibers creating a moldless, Out of Autoclave (OOA) composite manufacturing process. CF3D™ can also embed functionality with fiber optics and copper wires creating a part that can sense and react to environmental stimuli.Composite materials with their low weight, exceptional versatility, and tailorable properties have been slowly revolutionizing high-performance industries for decades. We have combined these materials with the latest technology in 3D printing and robotics opening new design possibilities for manufacturers and consumers. Traditional 3D printing and the composites manufacturing industry are plagued with the limitation of only being able to stack 2D slices; our technology can discretely print fibers in response to loads oriented in all 3 dimensions.Our patented technology, Continuous Fiber 3D Printing (CF3D™), is the cornerstone for the next industrial revolution. Our intellectual property portfolio consists of over 200 patented and patent-pending concepts and growing. We are seeking to develop and license our technology to industry participants in all sectors including aerospace, automotive, defense, construction, etc.

details.description: Jerry and Susie Larson, founders and owners of Mad Swede Brewing Company, are two Boiseans passionate about making amazing craft beer. Mad Swede is founded on the principles of brewing the highest quality beers by combining quality ingredients and innovative brewing processes.Over 30 years ago, while still in college, Jerry brewed his first beer. Jerry continued experimenting with new recipes over the years, meticulously recording different brews and methods, like a mad scientist dedicated to his art! Jerry and Susie both spent much of their careers working as engineers for Hewlett Packard, but as they both delved deeper into the world of beer, the desire to share their passion for great beer with the Boise community grew. Great beer is a blend of art and science!Jerry and Susie decided to open Mad Swede with the goal of making amazing beer using the practiced, fine-tuned methods Jerry spent years improving. Mad Swede is comprised of adventurous drinkers, brewers, dreamers, and thinkers who, like the Vikings themselves, dare to venture toward new and exciting territory.Mad Swede is deeply committed to community improvement. We are dedicated to making our community a better place to live through promoting local business, participating in events, supporting the arts, and striving for sustainability. High-Performance Engine Parts Manufacturer Relocates to Boise from CaliforniaBVEP Stakeholders,We are excited to share that Project Muscle, The Blower Shop, has selected Boise for their relocation. Please see the press release below.FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE: June 7, 2016Boise, IDAHO – The Blower Shop, a high-performance engine parts manufacturer for the automotive and marine markets, has announced that it is relocating its operations to Boise, Idaho from Simi Valley, California. In operation for more than three decades, The Blower Shop is recognized as a world leader in roots-style supercharging technology and manufactures superchargers as well as drive components for the professional racing industry along with street and marine enthusiasts.Ron Hayes, CEO of the Blower Shop, explains, “We selected the Boise area for our relocation because of the huge opportunity to expand the business within a growing region. Financially, it made sense to leave our leased space in Southern California and purchase a building centrally located in southeast Boise. We are a growing company trying to stay on the leading edge in our marketplace, and also expanding our product line within the automotive performance industry.”The Blower Shop has entered into an agreement to purchase a 13,000 square foot building in southeast Boise near the Boise Airport. It will house a full machine shop with both CNC and manual machines, and is expected to be online by August 2016.“Good manufacturing jobs are key to a strong economy,” said Mayor David Bieter. “I am thrilled that the Blower Shop chose Boise. They will be creating even more job opportunities for skilled Boiseans and strengthening our city’s forward momentum.”The Blower Shop plans to hire up to 20 full-time benefited employees within the first few years of operation, and will be working closely with the College of Western Idaho to support its training needs. The Blower Shop will manufacture, warehouse, sell and distribute its products all from the new location in Boise. The majority of its sales are to speed shops, engine builders, race teams, and other large distribution companies.About The Blower ShopSince 1984, The Blower Shop has been providing the top fuel, alcohol dragster and drag boat market with race-ready high performance superchargers. Leading the way in the development of cutting edge supercharging technology, the company focuses on increasing the performance of the roots style supercharger, making it the best choice for anyone in the racing industry. Today, the Blower Shop brings that technology not only to the professional racing industry, but to the street and marine enthusiast as well. Using its proprietary UDA technology, The Blower Shop is proud to manufacture a complete line of hand-built superchargers, intake manifolds, intercoolers, and components built in the USA. For more information, visit http://theblowershop.com

The American Dream. Everyone wants a piece of it as Thomas Wolfe once described it: "…to every man, regardless of his birth, his shining, golden opportunity…the right to live, to work, to be himself, and to become whatever thing his manhood and his vision can combine to make him." When Glen Seekins founded Seekins Precision, it was no surprise to those who knew him well. He comes from a long line of hard-working entrepreneurs, so becoming one himself was only natural. Following The American Dream seemed to be engrained in his DNA.A 2004 deer hunt that was unsuccessful due to broken scope rings spurred Glen to develop a concept for rings that could withstand the elements of the Idaho mountains while weighing less than tactical steel rings. Drawing upon his mechanical design background, Glen returned from the hunt, fired up his CAD program, and spent the next few evenings designing Seekins Precision’s flagship product: SP Scope Rings. He took his design to the machine shop that employed him at the time, and together they manufactured the first set of rings. The design of the SP Scope Rings has not changed since it was first mounted on Glen’s hunting rifle.When the rings became extremely popular in the local shooting community, Glen’s entrepreneurial spirit immediately went into overdrive. He continued to work as a mechanical designer by day, and by night, he trained himself on a rented Computer Numerical Control (CNC) machine and built scope rings. A few months later, Glen and his wife, Katie, took a leap of faith and purchased the machine, which they housed in their garage. During those early days, Glen would manufacture, assemble, and ship the rings while Katie managed the orders and accounting side of the business. By November of 2005, business had increased enough for Glen to leave his design job, and Seekins Precision became a full-time operation.The demand for Seekins Precision’s products was astonishing, and it wasn’t long before Glen and Katie relocated from their garage to a 1,500 square foot local business incubator. Around the same time, Glen designed and manufactured Seekins Precision’s first billet lower and unveiled it at SHOT Show. Upon returning, he began designing a full line of AR products.After the addition of employees and machinery in 2010, Seekins Precision had outgrown their initial incubator space and moved into the largest one available, which was 7,500 square feet. They have continued to grow and are again out of space, but in August 2013, Seekins Precision purchased land for a building they will move into upon completion in March 2014. With over 25,000 square feet, it provides ample room for growth, an important feature since Seekins Precision has expanded to include more than ten major product lines (including complete rifles) since its inception.The Seekins’ version of The American Dream has been realized in the ten years Seekins Precision has been in business, and they are grateful to the customers and friends they have made over the years. Drop in and see them soon at 159 American Way, Lewiston, Idaho.

Precision EngineeringFactor 55 products are designed and manufactured using state of the art technologies. All of our products are designed using SolidWorks CAD systems and stress analyzed using COSMOS Finite Element Simulation software. The FEA results allow us to optimize a design concept by adding or removing material or changing material properties where necessary.We then validate our theoretical results by instrumenting and destructively testing prototypes of all of our product designs. This is conducted at a test and measurement facility that is also certified for National Defense Department rigging and hoist testing.Most of our products are manufactured right here in Idaho within a 10 mile radius. Both the ProLink and Winch Lock bolts are manufactured from CNC machined billet material. No cheap castings or forgings for us.At Factor 55 we don't believe in engineering compromises. That's why we produce all of our products from aerospace quality materials. From 6000 and 7000 series aluminums, to 6AL-4V titanium double shear pins, we strive to offer you the very best designs made from the very best materials.

R & H Chrome Alloy wear parts are made entirely in our plant in Caldwell, Idaho. We cast our parts of an extremely durable material which makes our parts the longest lasting on the market. Milt Gillespie, PresidentTo get a sense of how Milt Gillespie views his role at Mariposa Labs, consider the word Kaizen. Kaizen is a Japanese philosophy that focuses on continuous improvement throughout all aspects of life. When applied to the workplace, Kaizen emphasizes all functions of a business, from the sales team and product development to employee training and the production line.Add to this Energy and Accuracy and you get a picture of an owner who is passionate about his business. Milt is continually looking for new means to provide the best value and the highest quality products to our clients.Lisa Swain, Sales Manager“It is refreshing to have good Communications!” says one client. “Lisa is totally on top of her game and we always know where we are in the process.” Lisa Swain brings 20+ years in sales and management to the Mariposa team. Her responsiveness keeps our clients in the loop at all times. Lisa is also a tremendous industry resource for current trends and ideas.Mary Hamilton, Quality Control ManagerMary Hamilton brings 14 years of experience in the personal care products industry. Her #1 objective in establishing and maintaining Mariposa’s exceptionally high standards is Compliance. “We mirror the FDA’s Good Manufacturing Practices [GMP],” says Mary. “Every aspect of product production is detailed in our Standard Operating Procedures. Everyone is trained to these standards which are reviewed and updated annually.”Dave Thompson, Manufacturing ManagerFlexibility is Dave Thompson’s byword. Where Mary assures every process proceeds by the book, Dave balances customer demand, real-time inventory, filling capacity, staffing and even weather fluctuations to maintain a smooth flow of products through the facility. Dave has spent 18 years in manufacturing and the last 13 years in the personal care products industry. His creative approach to using equipment efficiently has earned Mariposa many new and repeat clients.Kelly Kropf, Technical Director

details.description: Cradlepoint is the leading provider of cloud-based wired and wireless WAN networking solutions for Distributed and Mobile Enterprises. Cradlepoint solutions provide the strongest wireless and broadband performance while delivering proven network system interoperability. Cradlepoint’s broad family of high-performance router platforms are designed for deployment in mission-critical applications that require 24x7 connectivity. With both integrated wireless and wired WAN and non-integrated versions, our solutions are ideal for distributed and mobile operations and emerging industries that require either remote connectivity or multi-WAN redundancy. Cradlepoint’s NetCloud platform enables enterprise network administrators to easily create, monitor, manage, and maintain their distributed network running on different WAN sources from a single location. Founded in 2006, Cradlepoint has shipped over a 1.4 million routing platforms and offers solutions certified and promoted by major worldwide carriers. Cradlepoint is a privately held company with headquarters in Boise, Idaho.
